common_issues.title: Pieces Assistant Vague Responses
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Assistant responding with vague promises of future solutions instead of actionable answers. This occurs after multiple requests within a conversation, especially with large context sizes. No consistent reproduction steps or solutions are identified yet. Users suggest improving the assistant's ability to provide concrete help or clarify its limitations.

related_issues.title: Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"
related_issues.text:
Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**The Bug**
The chat assistant will respond claiming that it's working on a solution and will get back to you at a later date. 

**Expected Behaviour**
Get an actionable response with some suggested action/code.

**Details**
Most recent example of this kind of response ("_" is not part of the response just a redaction):

> "I'll carefully examine the data flow related to _, _, _, _, and _  to see if any inconsistencies could lead to bugs. Please give me a few minutes to review the code thoroughly with this specific focus in mind. I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible."

This has happened in three different conversations. I first noticed the behaviour this month, so not before updates preceding March. I promise I'm not trying to be lazy on this one, it's difficult to offer reproduction steps.

I use Claude 3.5 more than any option regularly.

The last conversation where this happened:

- I loaded 15 files into the context menu
- I sent 22 requests (and received 22 responses where it happened on the 22nd response)

I'll update this issue if there's anything I can do to make the reproduction more narrow.
## Conversation Summary

**Key points:**

* User (@seantiz) created an issue.
* Issue automatically triaged to the relevant Pieces team member.
* Expected follow-up within 24 hours.

**Problems identified:**

* No specific problem is mentioned in the conversation excerpt provided.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Related issue suggested: "Secret Message" Example doesn't work properly.
* Resources provided: Existing Issues, Documentation, YouTube Channel.

**Current status/outcome:**

* No follow-up from the Pieces team member yet.
* User awaits further communication.

related_issues.title: "Secret Message" Example doesn't work properly
related_issues.text:
"Secret Message" Example doesn't work properly
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When using LTM-2 to test the secret message example:
https://pieces.app/magic-moments/ltm

I got a strange response from the LLM:
Claude 3.5:
First Try:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1962a3e4-8b02-4d3f-bc8c-4bdd72c80aa6)
2. try: (waited longer on the website)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cd71c5c1-d5d5-4449-acd5-e070fb244fa9)

Gemini 2.0 Flash did fail completely:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/50735f7a-28a1-4563-b490-e10c271eca23)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users (@hra42, @joelash, @bartonfriedland) encountered an issue where PiecesOS ran in "basic mode" due to device constraints.
* This prevented them from accessing Workstream Activity and seeing LTM updates.
* The issue seemed related to a bug where vector support was not properly enabled even on compatible devices.
* Some users observed an "unknown origin" element in the telemetry browser with version 1.0.10.

**Problems Identified:**

* "Basic mode" due to device constraints caused missing functionality (Workstream Activity, LTM updates).
* Bug empêchait la fonction de recherche vectorielle sur les appareils compatibles.
* The presence of an "unknown origin" element raised concerns.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Restarting PiecesOS temporarily resolved the "basic mode" issue.
* A fix for the bug affecting vector search was promised for the next PiecesOS version.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue with "basic mode" should be resolved in the next PiecesOS update.
* The "unknown origin" element requires further investigation.
* Users can workaround the issue by restarting PiecesOS.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation highlights the importance of clear documentation for unexpected events like "basic mode".
* The "unknown origin" element might be related to a previous installation of PiecesOS.

related_issues.title: Pieces desktop this message is empty please try again
related_issues.text:
Pieces desktop this message is empty please try again
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces for Developers 4.0.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When copy paste code sencond time in Ask anything give error  this message is empty please try again
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* Multiple users reported encountering the "Pieces desktop this message is empty please try again show error" when attempting to send messages.
* This issue appears to affect both Mac and Windows versions of the desktop app.
* Users observed the message appearing after sending the first message in a new chat or attempting to send a second message.

**Problems Identified:**

* The error message indicates an issue with sending messages within the Pieces desktop app.
* This appears to be a widespread issue affecting various users and platforms.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces team acknowledged the issue and proposed a patch release to address it.
* The patch release was implemented and deployed on March 12th, 2025.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue appears to be resolved based on a user confirmation after the patch release.
* No further updates or reports on the issue are present in the conversation.

**Overall:**

The conversation highlights a bug within the Pieces desktop app affecting message sending functionality. The problem was identified and addressed by the Pieces team through a patch release, successfully resolving the issue for users.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App Errors and Slow Performance
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Desktop app being slow, unresponsive, or showing errors like 'this message is empty.' This seems to occur across Windows and Mac. Solutions include updating to the latest Pieces OS and Desktop versions, which include performance improvements and bug fixes.

related_issues.title: Pieces desktop application is very slow/laggy, not generating any response in copilot chat.
related_issues.text:
Pieces desktop application is very slow/laggy, not generating any response in copilot chat.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.0.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces desktop application is working very much slow after latest update, takes very much time to give any response. Even after doing a hard reset active runtime, it just do not work. 
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Copilot Slowness

**Key Points:**

* Users reported Copilot lagging and being significantly slower than before.
* This issue was confirmed by multiple users, including g0ldyy and JerryBenChizzy.
* The problem persisted even after hard resetting the active runtime.

**Identified Problems:**

* A bug in the "Hard-Reset Active Runtime" feature caused a websocket not to re-initialize correctly.
* This resulted in the Copilot infinitely hanging on the loading indicator after sending a message.
* Even after the fix, some users like harshilsodani and navdeepdev459 continued to experience slowness.

**Solutions:**

* Pieces team identified and fixed the bug causing the Copilot to hang.
* The fix was released in Pieces OS 10.0.2 & Pieces Desktop 3.0.2.
* A subsequent update, version 3.1.0 of the Desktop app, contained further performance improvements.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue should be resolved for most users after updating to the latest versions.
* However, some users might still experience slowness due to other factors like hardware limitations or internet connectivity.

**Additional Notes:**

* The team offered to schedule a chat with affected users to diagnose the issue in real-time.
* Harshilsodani reported the issue resurfacing after updating to Pieces OS 10.0.3 and Desktop app version 3.0.2.

**Overall, the Copilot slowness issue has been addressed and resolved for most users. However, if you continue to experience slowness, consider contacting the Pieces team for further assistance.**

common_issues.title: Pieces extension conflicts causing UI/Functionality issues
common_issues.description: Users report conflicts between Pieces extensions and other software, particularly in Visual Studio and web browsers. Issues include uneditable fields in SQL Server Object Explorer and malfunctioning embed buttons. Troubleshooting involves disabling the extension or specific features. The Pieces team actively investigates and addresses these issues through patches and updates.

related_issues.title: Pieces Visual Studio 2022 extension conflict with SQL Server Object Explorer
related_issues.text:
Pieces Visual Studio 2022 extension conflict with SQL Server Object Explorer
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Visual Studio

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

With Pieces Extension installed in Visual studio 2022, SQL database field is not editable (not clickable?)

Reproduce: 
- Connect to any SQL server with some table, choose a table and right click -> View Data
- Try edit the database's table field (the field will be unable to focus, so unable to edit)

* SQL database is editable again after disable pieces extension and restart VS.
* Try turn off everything in the extension's UserPreference did not work.
* While you can not edit a field, but delete a row is possible (so maybe some UI conflict?)

Here are some picture

Without the extension: the edit cursor shown up when click on field
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c45dbafe-29c7-4acd-9827-b34cd0cd76f7)

With the extension: the edit cursor did not show up. Clicking just selected the field.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8f430ff6-18f8-41fe-a58e-42ebbeec3be2)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @hikineet98 reported an issue where the cursor disappears after editing a cell in a script file using the Pieces for Visual Studio plugin.
* The issue occurs specifically when the user tabs or removes the edit cursor from the cell.
* Developer @robert-at-pieces was able to replicate the issue but the cause remains unclear.

**Problems Identified:**

* The cursor disappears after editing a cell, making further editing impossible.
* The cause of the issue is unknown, making it difficult to fix.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* No solutions have been proposed or implemented yet.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is still under investigation and a solution is currently unknown.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue seems to be related to a conflict between the Tool Window and the Pieces for Visual Studio plugin.

**Current status/outcome:**

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Installation and Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS installation ignoring default system app locations and encountering launch issues on Windows. Suggested solutions include updating App Installer, configuring antivirus software like Kaspersky to allow Pieces OS processes, and ensuring Pieces OS is installed in the correct location.

related_issues.title: Installation doesn't follow the System Apps default location
related_issues.text:
Installation doesn't follow the System Apps default location
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

There's no opportunity for the User to choose where the Pieces OS is installed or where any data that's collected is stored. From Windows 10 onwards there is a system feature to set where new content is to be stored by default. This is in Settings/System/Storage.

You can set where new Apps will be installed, new documents are stored, Music, etc.

Once this is set I would expect a current application to follow the default installation setting rather than hardcode it for the Boot drive.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

This conversation relates to a support request submitted by `bpluly` regarding an issue with Pieces OS. The issue appears to be related to automatic updates or launching Pieces OS. 

**Key Points:**

* User `bpluly` submitted an issue regarding Pieces OS.
* The Pieces Support Bot responded with an acknowledgement and helpful resources.
* The bot categorized the issue and routed it to the appropriate team member.
* The bot suggested two potentially related issues for the user to review.
* The bot provided links to existing issues, documentation, and the YouTube channel.

**Problems Identified:**

* The specific nature of `bpluly`'s issue is unclear.
* It could be related to automatic updates failing or Pieces OS not launching.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces Support Bot automatically categorized and routed the issue to the relevant team member.
* The bot suggested potentially related issues for the user to review.
* The bot provided links to resources that might help the user.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue has been routed to the appropriate team member.
* `bpluly` will receive a follow-up within 24 hours.

**Additional Notes:**

* The summary focuses on the key details of the conversation and provides a concise overview of the issue and its current status.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS Update fails
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS Update fails
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The notification popped up saying an update was available so I clicked Update and a few seconds later got this message box:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b14dc8ab-632a-4095-b45b-7bbaba3c70ce)

This is on a very fresh Windows 11 installation.
## GitHub Issue Summary: Pieces OS Launch Issue

**Key Points:**

* Users are experiencing issues launching Pieces OS on Windows, specifically with App Installer technology.
* Some users are also experiencing issues with Kaspersky antivirus blocking Pieces OS processes.

**Problems Identified:**

* App Installer bug causing launch failures.
* Kaspersky antivirus blocking Pieces OS processes.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Update App Installer through the Microsoft Store.
* Configure Kaspersky to allow Pieces OS processes.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue with App Installer may be resolved by updating it.
* The issue with Kaspersky may require configuring the antivirus to allow Pieces OS processes.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue with App Installer is similar to other reported issues (#627, #624).
* The provided screenshot by @bejokun shows the error message.
* The issue seems specific to Windows users.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Installation and Update Issues
common_issues.description: Users are reporting issues with Pieces OS installation, updates, and data backup/restore. Problems include personal domain registration failures, backup/restore malfunctions, and conflicts with antivirus software. Suggested solutions involve registering new personal domains, configuring antivirus settings, and updating the application.

related_issues.title: Personal Domain backup
related_issues.text:
Personal Domain backup
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I want to sync this PC to another PC，but i cann't backup the lastest data.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/bfb4fb14-5e7f-45c7-828f-5f77f550453a)

this is another PC

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3c2d880e-a1b2-40c1-82b1-9935bffbf8fb)
## **GitHub Issue Conversation Summary**

**Key Points Raised:**

* User is unable to change personal domain after copying com.pieces.os and com.pieces.pfd to another PC.
* User is also unable to backup and restore their current computer using the existing personal domain. 

**Problems Identified:**

* Personal domain registration failure due to existing registration.
* Backup/restore malfunction preventing data transfer.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Registering a new personal domain.
* Clicking the refresh button to initiate the backup/restore process.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User acknowledged the issue with personal domain registration being unavailable.
* User requested clarification on directly backing up and creating a new personal domain.

**Missing Information:**

* Whether the user attempted to register a new personal domain as suggested.
* Whether the user was able to resolve the backup/restore issue.

**Next Steps:**

* User needs to confirm if they attempted to register a new personal domain.
* User needs to provide more details regarding the backup/restore issue if it persists.

## GitHub Issue Summary: Pieces OS Launch Issue

**Key Points:**

* Users are experiencing issues launching Pieces OS on Windows, specifically with App Installer technology.
* Some users are also experiencing issues with Kaspersky antivirus blocking Pieces OS processes.

**Problems Identified:**

* App Installer bug causing launch failures.
* Kaspersky antivirus blocking Pieces OS processes.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Configure Kaspersky to allow Pieces OS processes.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

recommendations: **Address Pieces Assistant's Vagueness:** Investigate and improve Pieces Assistant's ability to provide concrete solutions or clearly communicate its limitations, especially in long conversations or with large context sizes.
**Prioritize Desktop App Performance:** Focus on resolving the issues causing slow performance and errors in the Pieces Desktop app, as it's a common pain point across Windows and Mac.

**Improve Extension Compatibility:** Allocate resources to investigate and address conflicts between Pieces extensions and other software, such as Visual Studio and web browsers, to ensure seamless integration.

**Review Pieces OS Installation:** Examine and clarify the Pieces OS installation process, particularly regarding default system app locations and potential conflicts with antivirus software like Kaspersky.
**Enhance Data Backup and Restore:** Investigate and resolve issues related to personal domain registration, backup/restore functionality, and data synchronization to ensure a smooth user experience.

**Proactively Monitor Common Issues:** Develop a system to proactively monitor and address common issues, such as those related to Pieces Assistant, Desktop App performance, and extension compatibility, to minimize user impact and support tickets.

**Improve Communication on Known Issues:** Provide clear and concise communication to users about known issues, workarounds, and expected resolution timelines to manage expectations and reduce support requests.

**Gather More Detailed User Reports:** Encourage users to submit detailed bug reports, including reproduction steps, screenshots, and system information, to help developers diagnose and fix issues more efficiently.

**Consider a Bug Bounty Program:** Explore implementing a bug bounty program to incentivize security researchers and users to identify and report vulnerabilities, improving the overall security and stability of Pieces products.
